set.name: This Website
set.description: You're looking at it! I created this with Bootstrap for the layout and Nunjucks for templating. I avoided Yeoman this time because I wanted to really get my hands dirty with creating the stuff Yeoman takes care of for you, like the Gulp flow. Plus I knew it would be a very simple site. Go ahead and peruse the source code.

set.name: Random Music
set.description: This is a Python module I'm working on to randomly generate musical chord progressions based on a given probability mass function (PMF). I certainly wouldn't call it AI or Artificial Creativity, but I'm hoping it might serve as a fun tool to aid musicians in accessing their own creativity. It's very early in development and it's only available so far as a module, but if you know basic Python you should be able to figure it out from the source code, or just install it from PyPI with pip install rcpg. I'm currently working on wrapping it in a web app to allow non-technical end users to enter their own PMFs. This is my first time creating something from the beginning using test driven development. The idea was inspired by Langorhythm

set.name: Friends Website
set.description: I originally made this Django app primarily to store the membership list for the Friends of the Grafton Public Library. When I became Membership Chair in 2015, I was given a single over-complicated Excel sheet with rows organized by both individual and family. First I split that out into a relational database (a table for individuals and a table for families), but when I realized that eventually there would be a new Membership Chair who didn't know SQL, I decided to wrap it in Django's beautiful built-in admin app. Then I decided the Friends could use a public website, instead of the single page we had on the library's site, so I built that as well. It reaches into the DB for the board/committee data to display it on the About page. I plan to build out a login system for members to check their membership status and renew their dues online - probably via PayPal, but I may decide to integrate with Stripe, which I've used a little bit for work. See source.

set.name: Mancala AI
set.description: This is a simple mancala web app. It's all front end - the logic is purely client JavaScript. The cool part is the artificial intelligence algorithm that plays against you. It uses a minimax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning to allow deeper searching within a reasonable time. I used the model view controller pattern, as well as JavaScript object constructors and prototype manipulation, to demonstrate my skill with JavaScript's prototypal inheritance. I used jQuery to link the MVC's controller and view. See source.

set.name: The Library
set.description: I've served on the board of directors for The Friends of the Grafton Public Library since June 2015, first as the Membership Chair, and now as President. I've managed the membership list and created our website (listed under the project section), sent mass emails via Constant Contact and MailChimp, organized fundraisers, solicited donations, led meetings, and achieved consensus among the board on controversial issues. My biggest accomplishment so far is leading a political campaign for a $16.6 million library expansion project. Due to complex local politics, it was a lot more controversial than you'd expect; the same effort lost in a massive 63%-to-37% landside in 2011, but we managed to win in 2017 with 56% over 44%.

set.name: Music
set.description: Ever since I started piano lessons in second grade, music has been an important part of my life - much less important in recent years, but it's still there.  More than anything, I'm interested in music theory, but I also play piano and guitar, sing bass, and have dabbled in flute, fife, tin whistle, recorder, ocarina, and djembe.

set.name: Science
set.description: Before becoming a software engineer, I majored in psychology, minored in biology, and did the pre-med track. After deciding not to go to med school and before getting my MS in Computer Science, I worked for four years as a biomed lab tech in a behavioral neuroendocrinology lab and an orthopedics lab (where I created the image above). You can take a look at my pubications on PubMed. I'm particularly interested in psychology, neuroscience, and evolution.
